title: Fix production deployment failure and retry deploy

requirements.text: Resolve the production deployment error so the app can be successfully deployed, then perform a fresh production deployment retry. Identify the root cause of the previous deployment failure (build/bundle errors, canister configuration issues, frontend asset build issues, or backend canister build issues) and apply the minimal code/config changes needed to make deployment succeed without changing existing app behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: A production deployment completes successfully with no deployment errors.
After deployment, the app loads in the browser and the existing routes render (Home, How It Works, Disclaimer, About Us, Contact, Privacy Policy).
The Home page simulator flow still works end-to-end: click "Get Followers" shows the 60-second loading state and then shows exactly one random result message.
No new external API calls are introduced; the simulator logic remains client-side only.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only components must be composed, not edited).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add migration.mo if an existing stable state upgrade requires it.
Do not add external API calls or any real Instagram integration; do not collect or store passwords.
nonGoals: Adding new pages, new gameplay features, or changing existing UI copy beyond what is strictly necessary to fix deployment.
Implementing new backend functionality (the app remains frontend-only for the simulator logic).
